request.description:
This is a POST request, submitting data to an API via the request body. This request submits JSON data, and the data is reflected in the response.

A successful POST request typically returns a `200 OK` or `201 Created` response code.

This is a GET request and it is used to "get" data from an endpoint. There is no request body for a GET request, but you can use query parameters to help specify the resource you want data on (e.g., in this request, we have `id=1`).

A successful GET response will have a `200 OK` status, and should include some kind of response body - for example, HTML web content or JSON data.

response.name: getAllBadges
show
updateBadge

body.raw:
{ "license_number": "12345",
  "type": "NGO",
  "bio": "Test organization",
  "website": "https://test.org",
  "user_id": 1,
  "status" : "notactive" // Add this line only for System-admin
 }

{ "title": "Volunteer Program", "description": "Helping organize community events and workshops.", "type": "volunteering", "start_date": "2026-02-01", "end_date": "2026-03-01", "status": "pending", "organization_id": 3, "location_id": 5 }

{
  "title": "Volunteer Program - Updated",
  "description": "Helping organize community events and workshops with more focus on youth.",
  "type": "volunteering",
  "start_date": "2026-02-05",
  "end_date": "2026-03-10",
  "status": "approved",
  "organization_id": 1,
  "location_id": 5,
  "skills": [
    { "name": "Event Management" },
    { "name": "Community Outreach" }
  ]
}
